translation: 1. Tâ-Sîn-Mîm.
2. These are the Verses of the manifest Book [(this Qur’ân), which was promised by Allâh in the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel), makes things clear].

arabic_text: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 3. It may be that you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are going to kill yourself with grief, that they do not become believers [in your Risalah (Messengership) i.e. in your Message of Islâmic Monotheism].[1]

arabic_text: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
translation: 4. If We will, We could send down to them from the heaven a sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ
translation: 5. And never comes there unto them a Reminder as a recent revelation from the Most Gracious (Allâh), but they turn away therefrom.

arabic_text: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
translation: 6. So they have indeed denied (the truth - this Qur’ân), then the news of what they mocked at will come to them.

arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ
translation: 7. Do they not observe the earth - how much of every good kind We cause to grow therein?

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 8. Verily, in this is an Ayâh (proof or sign), yet most of them (polytheists, pagans who do not believe in Resurrection) are not believers.
9. And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

arabic_text: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
translation: 10. And (remember) when your Lord called Mûsâ (Moses) (saying): "Go to the people who are Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers) -
11. "The people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh): Will they not fear Allâh and become righteous?"

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
translation: 12. He said: "My Lord! Verily, I fear that they will belie me,

arabic_text: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ
translation: 13. "And my breast straitens, and my tongue expresses not well. So send for Hârûn (Aaron) (to come along with me).

arabic_text: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ
translation: 14. "And they have a charge of crime against me, and I fear they will kill me."

arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
translation: 15. (Allâh) said: "Nay! Go you both with Our Signs. Verily We shall be with you, listening.

arabic_text: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 16. "And go both of you to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), and say: ‘We are the Messengers of the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
17. "So allow the Children of Israel to go with us.’ "

arabic_text: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
translation: 18. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said [to Mûsâ (Moses)]: "Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you did dwell many years of your life with us.

arabic_text: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
translation: 19. "And you did your deed, which you did (i.e. the crime of killing a man) while you were one of the ingrates."

arabic_text: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
translation: 20. Mûsâ (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was ignorant (as regards my Lord and His Message).

arabic_text: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
translation: 21. "So I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord has granted me Hukm (i.e. religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood), and made me one of the Messengers.

arabic_text: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
translation: 22. "And this is the past favour with which you reproach me: that you have enslaved the Children of Israel."
23. Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists)?"

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
translation: 24. [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."
25. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)?"
26. [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers!"

arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
translation: 27. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
translation: 28. [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"

arabic_text: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ
translation: 29. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "If you choose an ilâh (god) other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."
30. [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Even if I bring you something manifest (and convincing)?"

arabic_text: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
translation: 31. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ
translation: 32. So [Mûsâ (Moses)] threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.

arabic_text: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
translation: 33. And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!

arabic_text: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ
translation: 34. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said to the chiefs around him: "Verily! This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer.

arabic_text: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ
translation: 35. "He wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery: what is it then that you command?"

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
translation: 36. They said: "Put him off and his brother (for a while), and send callers to the cities;
37. "To bring up to you every well-versed sorcerer."
38. So the sorcerers were assembled at a fixed time on a day appointed.
39. And it was said to the people: "Are you (too) going to assemble?

arabic_text: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
translation: 40. "That we may follow the sorcerers [who were on Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) religion of disbelief] if they are the winners."

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
translation: 41. So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh): "Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?"

arabic_text: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ
translation: 42. He said: "Yes, and you shall then verily be of those brought near (to myself)."

arabic_text: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ
translation: 43. Mûsâ (Moses) said to them: "Throw what you are going to throw!"

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
translation: 44. So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said: "By the might of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), it is we who will certainly win!"

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ
translation: 45. Then Mûsâ (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all that they falsely showed!
46. And the sorcerers fell down prostrate.
47. Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
48. "The Lord of Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)."

arabic_text: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
translation: 49. [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
translation: 50. They said: "No harm! Surely, to our Lord (Allâh) we are to return.

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 51. "Verily we really hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers [in Mûsâ (Moses) and in the Monotheism which he has brought from Allâh]."

arabic_text: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
translation: 52. And We revealed to Mûsâ (Moses), saying: "Depart by night with My slaves, verily you will be pursued."
53. Then Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) sent callers to (all) the cities.
54. (Saying): "Verily these indeed are but a small band.
55. "And verily, they have done what has enraged us.
56. "But we are a host all assembled, amply fore-warned."
57. So, We expelled them from gardens and springs,
58. Treasures, and every kind of honourable place.
59. Thus [We turned them (Pharaoh’s people) out] and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.
60. So they pursued them at sunrise.

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ
translation: 61. And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Mûsâ (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ
translation: 62. [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."

arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: 63. Then We revealed to Mûsâ (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like huge mountain.
64. Then We brought near the others [Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) party] to that place.
65. And We saved Mûsâ (Moses) and all those with him.
66. Then We drowned the others.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 67. Verily in this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.
68. And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
69. And recite to them the story of Ibrâhîm (Abraham).

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
translation: 70. When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

arabic_text: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ
translation: 71. They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."
72. He said: "Do they hear you, when you call on (them)?
73. "Or do they benefit you or do they harm (you)?"

arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ
translation: 74. They said: "(Nay) but we found our fathers doing so."
75. He said: "Do you observe that which you have been worshipping -
76. "You and your ancient fathers?

arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 77. "Verily they are enemies to me, save the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
78. "Who has created me, and it is He Who guides me.
79. "And it is He Who feeds me and gives me to drink.
80. "And when I am ill, it is He who cures me.
81. "And Who will cause me to die, and then will bring me to life (again).

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: 82. "And Who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Recompense, (the Day of Resurrection).

arabic_text: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
translation: 83. My Lord! Bestow Hukm (religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) on me, and join me with the righteous.

arabic_text: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
translation: 84. And grant me an honourable mention in later generations.
85. And make me one of the inheritors of the Paradise of Delight.

arabic_text: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
translation: 86. And forgive my father, verily he is of the erring.
87. And disgrace me not on the Day when (all the creatures) will be resurrected.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ
translation: 88. The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ
translation: 89. Except him who brings to Allâh a clean heart [clean from Shirk (polytheism) and Nifâq (hypocrisy)]."
90. And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqûn (the pious - See V.2:2).
91. And the (Hell) Fire will be placed in full view of the erring.

arabic_text: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ
translation: 92. And it will be said to them: "Where are those (the false gods whom you used to set up as rivals with Allâh) that you used to worship.

arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ
translation: 93. "Instead of Allâh? Can they help you or (even) help themselves?"
94. Then they will be thrown on their faces into the (Fire), they and the Ghâwûn (devils, and those who were in error).
95. And the whole hosts of Iblîs (Satan) together.
96. They will say while contending therein,

arabic_text: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ
translation: 97. By Allâh, we were truly in a manifest error,
98. When We held you (false gods) as equals (in worship) with the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists);
99. And none has brought us into error except the Mujrimûn [Iblîs (Satan) and those of human beings who commit crimes, murderers, polytheists, oppressors].
100. Now we have no intercessors,
101. Nor a close friend (to help us).

arabic_text: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 102. (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return (to the world), we shall truly be among the believers!

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 103. Verily in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
104. And verily, your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
105. The people of Nûh (Noah) belied the Messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation: 106. When their brother Nûh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
107. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
108. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 109. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
110. "So keep your duty to Allâh, fear Him and obey me."
111. They said: "Shall we believe in you, when the meanest (of the people) follow you?"

arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: 112. He said: "And what knowledge have I of what they used to do?

arabic_text: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ
translation: 113. "Their account is only with my Lord, if you could (but) know.
114. "And I am not going to drive away the believers.
115. I am only a plain warner."

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ
translation: 116. They said: "If you cease not, O Nûh (Noah) you will surely be among those stoned (to death)."
117. He said: "My Lord! Verily, my people have belied me.

arabic_text: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 118. Therefore judge You between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me."

arabic_text: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
translation: 119. And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
120. Then We drowned the rest (disbelievers) thereafter.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 121. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
122. And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
123. ‘Âd (people) belied the Messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation: 124. When their brother Hûd said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
125. "Verily I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
126. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 127. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn, and all that exists).
128. "Do you build high palaces on every high place, while you do not live in them?
129. "And do you get for yourselves palaces (fine buildings) as if you will live therein for ever.[1]
130. "And when you seize (somebody), seize you (him) as tyrants?
131. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
132. "And keep your duty to Him, fear Him Who has aided you with all (good things) that you know.
133. "He has aided you with cattle and children.
134. "And gardens and springs.

arabic_text: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
translation: 135. "Verily, I fear for you the torment of a Great Day."

arabic_text: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ
translation: 136. They said: "It is the same to us whether you preach or be not of those who preach.
137. "This is no other than the false tales and religion of the ancients, [Tafsir At-Tabarî]
138. "And we are not going to be punished."

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 139. So they belied him, and We destroyed them. Verily in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
140. And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
141. Thamûd (people) belied the Messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation: 142. When their brother Sâlih said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
143. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
144. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 145. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
146. "Will you be left secure in that which you have here?
147. "In gardens and springs.
148. And green crops (fields) and date-palms with soft spadix.
149. "And you hew out in the mountains, houses with great skill.
150. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
151. "And follow not the command of Al-Musrifûn [i.e. their chiefs: leaders who were polytheists, criminals and sinners],

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ
translation: 152. "Who make mischief in the land, and reform not."
153. They said: "You are only of those bewitched!

arabic_text: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
translation: 154. "You are but a human being like us. Then bring us a sign if you are of the truthful."

arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
translation: 155. He said: "Here is a she-camel: it has a right to drink (water), and you have a right to drink (water) (each) on a day, known.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
translation: 156. "And touch her not with harm, lest the torment of a Great Day should seize you."
157. But they killed her, and then they became regretful.

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 158. So the torment overtook them. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
159. And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
160. The people of Lût (Lot) (-who dwelt in the town of Sodom in Palestine) belied the Messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation: 161. When their brother Lût (Lot) said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
162. "Verily I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
163. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 164. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
165. "Go you in unto the males of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind),

arabic_text: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ
translation: 166. "And leave those whom Allâh has created for you to be your wives? Nay, you are a trespassing people!"

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ
translation: 167. They said: "If you cease not O Lût (Lot)! verily, you will be one of those who are driven out!"
168. He said: "I am, indeed, of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury your (this evil) action (of sodomy).
169. "My Lord! Save me and my family from what they do."
170. So We saved him and his family, all,
171. Except an old woman (his wife) among those who remained behind.
172. Then afterward We destroyed the others.

arabic_text: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
translation: 173. And We rained on them a rain (of torment). And how evil was the rain of those who had been warned!

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 174. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
175. And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
176. The dwellers of Al-Aikah [near Madyan (Midian)] belied the Messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
translation: 177. When Shu‘aib said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh (and obey Him)?
178. "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
179. "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: 180. "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).

arabic_text: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ
translation: 181. "Give full measure, and cause no loss (to others).
182. "And weigh with the true and straight balance.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
translation: 183. "And defraud not people by reducing their things, nor do evil, making corruption and mischief in the land.
184. "And fear Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old."
185. They said: "You are only one of those bewitched!

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
translation: 186. "You are but a human being like us and verily, we think that you are one of the liars!

arabic_text: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
translation: 187. "So cause a piece of the heaven to fall on us, if you are of the truthful!"
188. He said: "My Lord is the Best Knower of what you do."

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ
translation: 189. But they belied him, so the torment of the day of shadow (a gloomy cloud) seized them. Indeed that was the torment of a Great Day.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 190. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
191. And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
192. And truly, this (the Qur’ân) is a revelation from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
193. Which the trustworthy Rûh [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] has brought down
194. Upon your heart (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) that you may be (one) of the warners,
195. In the plain Arabic language.
196. And verily, it (the Qur’ân, and its revelation to Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is (announced) in the Scriptures [i.e. the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] of former people.

arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
translation: 197. Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars (like ‘Abdullâh bin Salâm رضي الله عنه who embraced Islâm)[1] of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?
footnotes: (V.26:197) See the footnote of (V.5:66) [The story about ‘Abdullâh bin Salâm رضي الله عنه].

translation: 198. And if We had revealed it (this Qur’ân) unto any of the non-Arabs,

arabic_text: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 199. And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
200. Thus have We caused it (the denial of the Qur’ân) to enter the hearts of the Mûjrimûn (criminals, polytheists, sinners).

arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
translation: 201. They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment.
202. It shall come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not.
203. Then they will say: "Can we be respited?"
204. Would they then wish for Our Torment to be hastened on?
205. Tell Me, (even) if We do let them enjoy for years,
206. And afterwards comes to them that (punishment) which they had been promised,

arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ
translation: 207. All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
translation: 208. And never did We destroy a township but it had its warners
209. By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.
210. And it is not the Shayâtîn (devils) who have brought it (this Qur’ân) down.
211. Neither would it suit them, nor they can (produce it).
212. Verily, they have been removed far from hearing it.

arabic_text: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ
translation: 213. So invoke not with Allâh another ilâh (god) lest you should be among those who receive punishment.
214. And warn your tribe (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of near kindred.[1]
footnotes: (V.26:214) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: When the Verse: "And warn your tribe (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of near kindred." (V.26:214) was revealed, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم went out, and when he had ascended As-Safa mountain, he shouted, "Yâ Sabâhâh!*" The people said, "Who is that?" "Then they gathered around him, whereupon he said, "Do you see? If I inform you that cavalrymen are proceeding up the side of this mountain, will you believe me?" They said, "We have never heard you telling a lie." Then he said, "I am a plain warner to you of a coming severe punishment." Abû Lahab said: "May you perish! You gathered us only for this reason?" Then Abû Lahab went away. So Sûrat Al-Masad "Perish the hands of Abû Lahab!" (V.111:1) was revealed. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadîth No.495). * "Yâ Sabâhâh!" is an Arabic expression used when one appeals for help or draws the attention of others to some danger.

arabic_text: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: 215. And be kind and humble to the believers who follow you.

arabic_text: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: 216. Then if they disobey you, say: "I am innocent of what you do."
217. And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
218. Who sees you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) when you stand up (alone at night for Tahajjud prayers).
219. And your movements among those who fall prostrate (to Allâh in the five compulsory congregational prayers).
220. Verily He, only He, is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
translation: 221. Shall I inform you (O people!) upon whom the Shayâtîn (devils) descend?
222. They descend on every lying, sinful person.
223. Who gives ear (to the devils and they pour what they may have heard of the Unseen from the angels), and most of them are liars.
224. As for the poets, the erring ones follow them,

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
translation: 225. See you not that they speak about every subject (praising people - right or wrong) in their poetry?
226. And that they say what they do not do.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
translation: 227. Except those who believe (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds, and remember Allâh much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged [by replying back in poetry to the unjust poetry (which the pagan poets utter against the Muslims)]. And those who do wrong will come to know by what overturning they will be overturned.
